thread.title: Wasatch Names Three Associate Portfolio Managers and Promotes Six Equity Research Analysts

author: cnbc.com
title: Wasatch Names Three Associate Portfolio Managers and Promotes Six Equity Research Analysts

organizations.name: wasatch emerging markets small cap fund

text:
SALT LAKE CITY--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Wasatch Advisors has named three Associate Portfolio Managers to the portfolio-management teams for three Wasatch Funds and related institutional portfolios.
Allison He, CFA , who joined Wasatch in 2013, has become an Associate Portfolio Manager for the Wasatch International Opportunities Fund. Kevin Unger, CFA , who joined Wasatch in 2015, has become an Associate Portfolio Manager for the Wasatch Emerging Markets Small Cap Fund. And Matt Dreith, CFA , who joined Wasatch in 2011, and has been an Associate Portfolio Manager for the Wasatch Emerging India Fund since 2016, has become an Associate Portfolio Manager for the Wasatch Emerging Markets Select Fund. The existing Portfolio Managers for these three funds and related institutional portfolios remain in place.
Roger Edgley, Director of International Research, commented, “We believe these promotions recognize the contributions, dedication and growing roles of Allison, Kevin and Matt. Our entire staff will continue to work together and share ideas in pursuit of the best risk-adjusted performance for our clients.”
Wasatch Fund / Strategy Portfolio Managers Team Additions Emerging Markets Select Ajay Krishnan, Lead Portfolio Manager Matt Dreith, Associate Portfolio Manager Roger Edgley, Portfolio Manager Scott Thomas, Associate Portfolio Manager Matt Dreith, Associate Portfolio Manager Emerging Markets Small Cap Roger Edgley, Lead Portfolio Manager Kevin Unger, Associate Portfolio Manager Andrey Kutuzov, Associate Portfolio Manager Scott Thomas, Associate Portfolio Manager Kevin Unger, Associate Portfolio Manager International Opportunities Jared Whatcott, Portfolio Manager Allison He, Associate Portfolio Manager / International Micro Cap Linda Lasater, Portfolio Manager Allison He, Associate Portfolio Manager Wasatch has also announced the promotion of six Junior Equity Research Analysts to Equity Research Analysts: Andrew Masuda, Austin Bone, Candace Dechant, Mick Rasmussen, Natalie Pesqué, and Thomas Bradley. This brings the total global investment team at Wasatch to 36 Portfolio Managers and Analysts.
“We’re pleased to employ such talented investment professionals who have already provided strong contributions and are ready to assume increased responsibilities at Wasatch,” said JB Taylor, longtime Portfolio Manager and CEO of Wasatch Advisors.
About Wasatch Advisors ®
Wasatch Advisors is the investment manager to Wasatch Funds, as well as to separately managed institutional and individual portfolios. Wasatch Advisors pursues a disciplined approach to investing, focused on bottom-up, fundamental analysis to develop a deep understanding of the investment potential of individual companies. In making investment decisions, the portfolio managers employ a uniquely collaborative process to leverage the knowledge and skill of the entire Wasatch Advisors research team. Wasatch Advisors is an employee-owned investment advisor founded in 1975 and headquartered in Salt Lake City, Utah. The firm had $16.6 billion in assets under management as of December 31, 2017. Wasatch Advisors, Inc. is registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940.
RISKS AND DISCLOSURES:
Mutual-fund investing involves risks, and loss of principal is possible. Investing in small or micro cap funds will be more volatile, and loss of principal could be greater than investing in large cap or more diversified funds. Investing in foreign securities, especially in emerging and frontier markets, entails special risks, such as unstable currencies, highly volatile securities markets, and political and social instability, which are described in more detail in the prospectus.
The investment objective of the Emerging Markets Select Fund, Emerging Markets Small Cap Fund and International Opportunities Fund is long-term growth of capital.
